title: How to Make a Pico de Gallo Salsa

steps.headline: Cut the tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and garlic into small pieces.
Start mixing the tomatoes, onions, garlic, and cilantro with the lime juice but don't blend them or mix them too hard.
steps.description: Too much mixing can make the salsa mushy.

steps.headline: Add a few drops from your favorite bottle of hot sauce: Tapatio and Tabasco.
Cut peppers in half lengthwise.
steps.description: Using the pointy part of a potato peeler, scoop out the seeds and discard. Fold gently into the salsa. Though traditionally made with fresh jalapeños, other peppers such as Serranos, Anaheim, or others can be used.

steps.headline: Add salt, regular or Kosher salt.
Stir if needed.
steps.description: Then wrap the container with plastic wrap or add a lid and set it in the fridge for at least 30 minutes for the flavors to mix.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Pico de gallo can be served in a bowl for diners to help themselves to or added to the meal plate or food. It's an ideal dish for barbecues and al fresco occasions. Serve with a teaspoon or with a jar of toothpicks; the latter item lets diners spear the chunkier bits!

text: Cut the tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and garlic into small pieces.  Start mixing the tomatoes, onions, garlic, and cilantro with the lime juice but don't blend them or mix them too hard. Too much mixing can make the salsa mushy. Add a few drops from your favorite bottle of hot sauce: Tapatio and Tabasco. This step is optional. Cut peppers in half lengthwise. Using the pointy part of a potato peeler, scoop out the seeds and discard. Fold gently into the salsa. Though traditionally made with fresh jalapeños, other peppers such as Serranos, Anaheim, or others can be used. Add salt, regular or Kosher salt.  Stir if needed. Then wrap the container with plastic wrap or add a lid and set it in the fridge for at least 30 minutes for the flavors to mix. Serve. Pico de gallo can be served in a bowl for diners to help themselves to or added to the meal plate or food. It's an ideal dish for barbecues and al fresco occasions. Serve with a teaspoon or with a jar of toothpicks; the latter item lets diners spear the chunkier bits!
